author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Helicopter tours of Vietnam's Quang Nam for tourists to start soonTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Helicopter tours of Vietnam’s Quang Nam for tourists to start soon
Tourists will soon be able to enjoy aerial view of the World Cultural Heritage of My Son Sanctuary in Vietnam’s central province of Quang Nam with the availability of helicopter tours, a local official said.
Preparations for the airborne services have been launched by the Vietnam Travel Mart outside the Khe The spring in the heritage’s complex, said Phan Ho, head of the management board of the My Son tourism and heritage site.
Vietnam News Agency (VNA) reported that service airplanes departing from the central city of Da Nang will fly around the area to give tourists a look at the mystery and unique architecture of Cham temples lying in the middle of the forest.
The site expects to welcome more than 250,000 domestic and foreign tourists in 2015.
Helicopter tours of My Son Sanctuary, first launched in April this year, have contributed to drawing vacationers to the site.
